i1.name: Flurry
description: {{sbc|Innate:}} After using an ability, '''Lee Sin's''' next 2 [[basic attack]]s within 3 seconds gain {{sti|attack speed|{{as|40% '''bonus''' attack speed}}}}, returning {{sti|energy|{{as|{{passive progression/deprecated version|3|20 to 40|1 to 13}} energy}}}} on the first attack and {{ft|half of that|{{sti|energy|{{as|{{passive progression/deprecated version|3|10 to 20|1 to 13}} energy}}}}}} on the second.
i1.notes: * ''Flurry'' will still restore energy even if the attacks are {{tip|dodge|dodged}}, {{tip|block|blocked}}, or {{tip|blind|missed}}.

r1.name: Dragon's Rage
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Lee Sin''' {{tip|root|roots}} the target enemy champion during the cast time after which he roundhouse kicks them, dealing {{as|physical damage}} and {{tip|airborne|knocking them back}} 1200 units over 1 second.
Enemies that collide with the displaced enemy receive {{as|'''bonus''' physical damage}} and are {{tip|airborne|knocked up}} for 1 second.
leveling: {{st|Collision Damage|{{ap|175 to 625}} {{as|(+ 200% '''bonus''' AD)}} {{as|(+ {{ap|12 to 18}}% of kicked target's '''bonus''' health)}}}}
r1.notes:
* Applies {{tip|spell damage}} to the primary target and {{tip|area damage}} to secondary targets.
* The [[spell indicator]] for this ability also displays the direction for the knock back relative to '''Lee Sin's''' position.
* If the target of ''Dragon Rage'' {{tip|death|dies}} initially on the first hit there will be no displacement of any kind.
* The {{tip|airborne|displacement's}} direction is decided at the moment of impact and not by '''Lee Sin''' and his target's relative locations on-cast (the only way for '''Lee Sin''' to control where his target is displaced is by using {{si|Flash}} before the cast time of ''Dragon's Rage'' ends).
** The collision damage buff of the target remains for the normal duration even if its trajectory is {{tip|airborne|displaced}} by another source (i.e - {{ai|Headbutt|Alistar}}).
* The ability will only go on {{sti|cooldown}} after performing the kick.
** Because of this, if {{ri|Electrocute}} triggers from the {{tip|root}} and [[kill|kills]] the enemy, the ability will not go on cooldown.
** If the target becomes {{tip|untargetable}}, leaves {{tip|sight}}, or dies before the cast time completes, ''Dragon's Rage'' cancels but does not go on cooldown.
* If the {{tip|airborne|knock back}} ends normally and is not interrupted early, the target may still knock other enemies for a brief period after they reach their destination.
